name: Actor
p1: Skilled at mimicry and dramatics, you gain the following benefits:
ul1: Increase your Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
ul2: You have an advantage on Deception and Performance checks when trying to pass yourself off as a different person.
ul3: You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the person speaking, or heard the creature make the sound, for at least 1 minute. A successful Insight check contested by your Deception check allows a listener to determine that the effect is faked.

name: Athlete
p1: You have undergone extensive physical training to gain the following benefits:
ul1: Increase your Strength or Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
ul2: When you are prone, standing up uses only 5 feet of your movement.
ul3: Climbing doesn't cost you extra movement.
ul4: You can make a running long jump or a running high jump after moving only 5 feet on foot, rather than 10 feet.

name: Alert
p1: Always on the lookout for danger, you gain the following benefits:
ul1: You can't be surprised while you are conscious.
ul2: You gain a +5 bonus to initiative.
ul3: Other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against you as a result of being unseen by you.

name: Charger
p1: When you use your action to Dash, you can use a bonus action to make one melee weapon attack or to shove a creature.
p2: If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line immediately before taking this bonus action, you either gain a +5 bonus to the attack's damage roll (if you chose to make a melee attack and hit) or push the target up to 10 feet away from you (if you chose to shove and you succeed).

name: Defensive Duelist
p1: When you are wielding a finesse weapon with which you are proficient and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your AC for that attack, potentially causing it to miss you.

name: Dual Wielder
p1: You master fighting with two weapons, gaining the following benefits:
ul1: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.
ul2: You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons you are wielding aren't light.
ul3: You can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.
